website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight and compact with everything the family photographer needs, the Nikon D5600 maintains its position as a great general-purpose dSLR for its price class.
pros: The Nikon D5600 delivers excellent photo quality for its price class, as well as performance that can keep up with your kids and pets
cons: It may be too small for people with larger hands and it turns off the self-timer after every shot in single-shot mode

customer_reviews.title: This has to be said.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe Nikon make decent cameras and camera bodies, but their software is worse than useless. There is an entire industry growing up for providing work arounds for Nikon's short comings like converting .NEF files to something accessible like .JPG. Nikon provides software allegedly for this purpose but it just doesn't work. I never got snapbridge to work in any useful way. I managed to transfer a few photos to the cloud, eventually, but definately no video - snapbridge needs a lot of time to do not much. Transfer using memory cards is way more practical.
customer_reviews.author: Ben P. O'regan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for family and vacation shooting.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy D7500 and ended up purchasing this. I discovered that D7500 is too big and too heavy with all the lenses and I can't carry all day. For my family and vacation photography this camera is perfect. The extra I spent on purchasing teh lenses I needed and I am glad that I did. Very light and it fits perfectly in my small hands. I took some amazing photos with this camera. I am so glad that I didn't but D7500 and purchased Tamrom 18-200 and one Sigma 10-24 Lenses instead with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Sinha

customer_reviews.title: Solid value pick
customer_reviews.text: I'm upgrading from a D40 and I am happy with my purchase. It brings a slew of new features in this camera, familiar interface, great quality pictures, and significantly better low light performance. None of that is surpising considering the D40 is now 10 years old but the D5600 is a solid choice in the mid-priced camera range. I don't say this often but Nikon is one brand I trust to provide great quality product.
customer_reviews.author: jpl

customer_reviews.title: Great images, terrible software.
customer_reviews.text: Great images, terrible software - which was supposedly the 'biggest update' - it's excruciatingly slow and unstable. It takes me more time to process with this vs the older d5500 and d5300 and d5200, all of which I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Alton

customer_reviews.title: My D200 took great pictures for a cropped sensor and this camera is no exception.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with the kit lens that came with my D200 ten years ago. Always loved the lens, but wanted a flip up screen and the ability to shoot video. This fit the bill nicely. Menu and functions were all Nikon familiar, so that was nice for me and cut down the learning curve substantially. My D200 took great pictures for a cropped sensor and this camera is no exception. I wished it was a mirrorless full frame, but Nikon isn't there yet.
customer_reviews.author: randy.neale

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a Nikon D3000. Definitely a big improvement in many ways. I'm happy with my purchase. I'm currently using a few different lenses, but my favorite walking around lens right now is the Sigma 17-50mm fixed F2.8. I'd buy the camera body without the lens and do some research on lens options.
customer_reviews.author: Hexley

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Nikon DSLR and as usual it's a winner. I use this camera mostly for recreational photography. I've been using it with a Nikon 18-140 mm AF-S DX NIKKOR Lens and a Rokinon 8 mm fisheye lens. Image quality is incredible. Love the touch screen capability. The in-camera effects are really amazing. SnapBridge software for Bluetooth and WiFi connectivity is fairly easy to use. Probably not a good camera for a beginner as the number of features might overwhelm someone who is new to DSLRs. Only complaint is no USB transfer cable.
customer_reviews.author: F-Stop

customer_reviews.title: Nikon D5600 - great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from a d3100 to the d5600 because of the higher megapixels and the higher capabilities of ISO. I am very satisfied with it's performance. The fact that you can move the display screen into all orientations is icing on the cake when you are shooting in odd positions. Bottom line is I love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A. Magri Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Love my Nikon!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great price for phenomenal camera!! I originally had another Nikon camera that lasted for 12 years. When it stopped working, I was pleasantly surprised to learn that Nikon cameras use the same lens mount so all I had to do was replace the body!!! Which was fantastic since I had purchased two new lenses within the past year! The updated features are awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Delinda G.

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera!! I am new to photography but I have been able to get some pretty incredible shots. I was very close to buying Sony Alpha series camera but went with a Nikon because my dad gave me some of his old film lenses that fit right on. This is a great camera to learn on and makes for a "B" camera when I upgrade in the future. Also I would get the extended warranty just because it covers everything! Hope this helps make a decision.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my D3000. This is nice and compact and lightweight as far as DSLR's go. Settings are similar and setting up the bridge was easy. I would have liked to upgrade but this was in the budget when my D3000 died.
customer_reviews.author: mjraal.2017

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera with convenient features...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera with cool features. I have zero complaints. Picture quality is on point, battery life is surprisingly good, and downloading wirelessly to my iPad works great. I’ve had some of the more “prosumer” models in the past and I had some reservations about this but it’s money well spent. No regerts! 😉
customer_reviews.author: Rocco III

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. Did research and found that for the price, this camera has the best feature set for still photography. Size, build quality, features, lens selection, and image quality make this the best entry level dslr.
customer_reviews.author: A. E. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Wrong model in the original box
customer_reviews.text: Box was right 5600 but the body inside was different one ot came out Nikon d3500
customer_reviews.author: Ri

customer_reviews.title: Excellent features for the money
customer_reviews.text: Much better low light performance than my previous D40. The moveable live view screen allows shooting from odd angles. The video capability was also surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.author: joec

customer_reviews.title: battery life terrible and wifi sucks
customer_reviews.text: the wifi drains battery terribly, the wifi controls are limited and have many errors to control camera. battery life not as expected or advertised. touch screen is nice feature, but wifi controls and app for nikon on phone is very poor. expected more from a major camera company.
customer_reviews.author: ashraf s kasto

customer_reviews.title: D5600 is a great SLR
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Nikon SLR. The advantages of technology are mind boggling. What ever pictures I take go to my iPhone, iPad and smart tv. I also updated my Nikon Flash. I am really enjoying my newest toy. I already have five lenses so I just bought the body.
customer_reviews.author: Howard J. Krugman

customer_reviews.title: D5600 do-format
customer_reviews.text: Nice high tech camera, steep learning curve, poor documentation supplied with the camera. There is a free 450 page manual for the camera in the form of a PDF that can be downloaded.
customer_reviews.author: Mpg

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from D40
customer_reviews.text: We paired the camera body with a Tamron 18-270 lens. Great combo Easy to shoot in Auto mode
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Loved Nikon forever. This was an upgrade from the 3500 and it definitely shows.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck in DSLR
customer_reviews.text: I sold my D7100 and even though I still have a D750, this little guy takes amazing pictures, and it’s way lighter to take on a day of photo shooting across town, great in low light.
customer_reviews.author: javier garza jr

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for beginners who want a little more
customer_reviews.text: Good camera for beginners who want a little more. The articulating touchscreen display is really worth the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: BobNC

customer_reviews.title: A good camera for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Only just started to use the camera. But so much better than the 3100 I have . So far everything is easier to set up and use than the 3100 . SnapBridge seems to work so far on an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin smith

customer_reviews.title: Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: Coupled with a 35mm 1.8 lens, this camera takes awesome low light photos.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Good starter camera body
customer_reviews.text: Hoping to be a bit more user friendly but youtube tutorials have helped me better use this camera.
customer_reviews.author: tvjones

customer_reviews.title: Price/value for great camera
customer_reviews.text: Ability to use lens I had purchased for my d3100
customer_reviews.author: Larry W. Keene

customer_reviews.title: feedback to the seller
customer_reviews.text: product is great! i love the wifi and bluetooth, that's the reason I ordered, I use for fun and photo classes. I am writing a feedback here since I didn't find the the option I was told to use to get my $10 refund. The leave seller's feedback I didn't see it in my screen. That's what I am using this....
customer_reviews.author: Don & Ines Karpowich

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful upgrade. The body is lightweight and all my lenses work with it. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Peg Grayson

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: My Wife loves her new camera. I have not used it, but she is ecstatic.
customer_reviews.author: Steven K. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great all around camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace the D3300 that I had used for a couple years. Right away using the new camera I could tell the low light autofocus was leaps and bounds better than the D3300. I don’t use the touch part of the screen much but being able to flip the screen out to look at it from different angles is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy DeVries

customer_reviews.title: Terrific upgrade!  And GPS link to phone works great!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome after week two, seems much much better than my D5100 in low light and the touch screen is nice. Picture quality is awesome. Snapbridge works for me but seems to take a lot of power so I disabled downloading of photos to my phone. I upgraded mostly to get GPS tagging from my phone which works great.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Stieglitz

customer_reviews.title: Great product all around
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great camera, bought a used one and it came in brand new condition
customer_reviews.author: Emilio Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Great second camera
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful camera for flower close-up. Small and light.
customer_reviews.author: Newton Liu

customer_reviews.title: Love Bluetooth-so easy!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE the bluetooth feature! No more messing around on the computer for simple uploads to etsy, Facebook, etc!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Satisfactory in every way as I know this camera well.
customer_reviews.text: Replacement camera body for the one that I am having repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Parker

customer_reviews.title: Very good to learn with, and to produce great results
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive entry into the world of DSLRs, but with many features you'd expect on a more expensive camera. Decent megapixels, compatibility with the full range of DX lenses, and a touchscreen-supported manual mode make this a perfect first shooter for someone moving up from a Point and Shoot or Smartphone Camera.
customer_reviews.author: Ewan Grantham

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable metering
customer_reviews.text: The only way I can get this camera to take decent pictures is in manual mode where I can account for inaccurate metering. The metering is off by several stops and it overexposes everything in all of the auto modes. I'm going to contact Nikon about it, but I'm pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: A great camera for those still learning the art of photography.
customer_reviews.text: So far the camera has worked as expected. I upgraded from a very outdated d3000. So, I'm loving some of the new features. I especially like the snapbridge app that allows me to see the pictures instantly and do simple edits on my mobile device. This feature will save me a lot of stress and possibly the need to find open wifi in California coastal towns where I typically vacation as there is a need for same day printing in some cases. I'm looking forward to putting it to some real use this spring.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Rice

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry Level Camera for astrophotography
customer_reviews.text: Great camera to begin astrophotography with.The picture shows a photograph of the Milky Way galaxy captured with the camera combined with a photo of a 3D Jigsaw puzzle model also captured with the D5600 with a reflection effect added. The 3 stars that make up the "summer triangle" can be seen clearly. I've been enjoying the camera very much.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Chapman

customer_reviews.title: I Like the WiFi and touch screen and all the amenities ...
customer_reviews.text: I Like the WiFi and touch screen and all the amenities the Nikon offer. I am a Nikonian. WiFi connection and controled by my iphone with air drop. I stop the family paparazzi with their iphone and just share my picture. Awesome. No complaints here. 😈
customer_reviews.author: tamulong

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend Cameta Camera.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera through Amazon from Cameta Camera. Cameta Camera is a wealth of knowledge and a great resource!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Product delivered on time in good shape! Bought it for a great price - ...
customer_reviews.text: Product delivered on time in good shape! Bought it for a great price - 474$ around Cyber Monday. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Spare Nikon DX Body for those who travel light.
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact Nikon DX-format body for traveling. Picture quality is excellent, as are the camera features. Snapbridge software is far from perfect, but I'm confident Nikon will fix this.
customer_reviews.author: MKilar

customer_reviews.title: The product is not working. Bought it approximately 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: The product is not working. Bought it approximately 6 months ago and all of the sudden the camera doesn't turn on and when it does it freezes and doesn't do anything.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resolution, the movable monitor is a great feature
customer_reviews.text: Light and versatile. Excellent resolution, the movable monitor is a great feature, especially for awkward situations. Has all the functionality required for creative photography at a great price point. I replaced my D300s for this model and it is a great trade
customer_reviews.author: GASTON

customer_reviews.title: The Nikon D5600 work very well. I used it ...
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon D5600 work very well. I used it at a sporting event and used snapbridge to post pictures during the event.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but the drawback: The Nikon CLS is only compatible with the sb-500
customer_reviews.text: Great camera! Small and with all the tech that I need! But it's expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Rumemi

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: missing battery and instructions from something that's suppose to be new.
customer_reviews.author: bob

product_meta.title: D5600 DX-format Digital SLR Body
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Body Only| Configuration:BaseImaging Lens Mount: Nikon F Camera Format: DX / (1.5x Crop Factor) Pixels: Actual: 24.78 Megapixel Effective: 24.2 Megapixel Max Resolution: 24 MP: 6000 x 4000 Aspect Ratio: 3:2 Sensor Type / Size: CMOS, 23.5 x 15.6 mm File Formats: Still Images: JPEG, RAW Movies: MOV, MPEG-4 AVC/H.264 Audio: Linear PCM (Stereo) Bit Depth: 14-bit Dust Reduction System: Yes Memory Card Type: SD SDHC SDXC Focus Control Focus Type: Auto & Manual Focus Mode: Automatic (A) Continuous-servo AF (C) Manual Focus (M) Single-servo AF (S) Autofocus Points: Phase Detection: 39, 9 cross-type Viewfinder/Display Viewfinder Type: Pentamirror Viewfinder Eye Point: 17.00 mm Viewfinder Coverage: 95% Viewfinder Magnification: Approx. 0.82x Diopter Adjustment: - 1.7 to +0.5 m Display Screen: 3.2 Rear Touchscreen Swivel LCD (1,037,000) Screen Coverage: 100% Diagonal Angle of View: 170.0° Exposure Control ISO Sensitivity: Auto, 100-25600 Shutter: 30 - 1/4000 second, Bulb Mode Remote Control: WR-1 WR-10 MC-DC2 (Optional) Metering Method: Center-weighted average metering Matrix Spot metering Exposure Modes: Modes: Aperture Priority, Manual, Program, Scene Modes, Shutter Priority Metering Range: EV 0.0 - EV 20.0 Compensation: -5 EV to +5 EV (in 1/3 or 1/2 EV steps) continuous shooting Up to 5 fps at 24.2 MP Up to 4 fps at 24.2 MP Up to 3 fps at 24.2 MP white balance modes: Auto cloudy direct sunlight flash fluorescent incandescent present manual shade flash modes auto/red-eye reduction fill-in rear curtain slow sync/red-eye reduction built-in flash: Yes guide No.: 39.37' (12 m) ISO100 Max Sync Speed: 1 / 200 seconds flash compensation: -3 EV to +1 EV (in 1/3 or 1/2 EV steps) Dedicated flash system: ITTL External Flash Connection: Hot Shoe AV Reco. Operating environment: 0–40 °C (+32–104 °F).
